title: Conversation: Mounira Al Solh with Hendrik Folkerts and Jordan Carter
hero_caption: <p>Courtesy the artist and Sfeir-Semler Gallery Beirut / Hamburg.</p>
description:
On the occasion of the opening of Mounira Al Solh: I strongly believe in our right to be frivolous, Al Solh will discuss her multi-year drawing and embroidery project in the context of the recent histories of the Middle East in which her work is embedded. The artist will be interviewed by exhibition curators, Hendrik Folkerts, Dittmer Curator of Modern and Contemporary Art, and Jordan Carter, Assistant Curator of Contemporary Art.

*Museum admission is free for Illinois residents every Thursday, 5:00–8:00—including during this event.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
